content: That's an interesting twist on the worm's backstory, with the romantic interest and jealousy adding an extra layer of complexity to the character. It could also create a sense of tragedy for the worm, as it is torn between its love for Sarah and its loyalty to Jareth, ultimately leading to its downfall. This could further emphasize the idea of the endless cycle of suffering in the Labyrinth, with characters being drawn into the same patterns of behavior, even as they try to break free from them.
